Plot Barcode Hit

Source: R/plot_barcode_hit.R
plot_barcode_hit.Rd

Create a Barcode plot for the Hit

plot_barcode_hit(
  screenR_Object,
  matrix_model,
  contrast,
  number_barcode = 3,
  gene,
  quantile = c(-0.5, 0.5),
  labels = c("Negative logFC", "Positive logFC")
)

Arguments

screenR_Object

The ScreenR object obtained using the create_screenr_object

matrix_model

the matrix that will be used to perform the linear model analysis

contrast

An object created with makeContrasts function.

number_barcode

Number of barcode to have under the median

gene

A gene name to plot

quantile

Quantile to display on the plot

labels

Title of the plot

Value

The barcode plot

Examples

object <- get0("object", envir = asNamespace("ScreenR"))
matrix_model <- model.matrix(~ slot(object, "groups"))
colnames(matrix_model) <- c("Control", "T1_T2", "Treated")
contrast <- limma::makeContrasts(Treated - Control, levels = matrix_model)

plot_barcode_hit(object, matrix_model,
    contrast = contrast,
    gene = "Gene_300"
)
#> Using classic mode.

#> NULL
